name: eigenexa

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description: EigenExa is a high-performance eigenvalue solver.

dependencies.name: autoconf
dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools

dependencies.name: automake
dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: lapack
dependencies.description:
Automatically Tuned Linear Algebra Software, generic shared ATLAS is an
approach for the automatic generation and optimization of numerical
software. Currently ATLAS supplies optimized versions for the complete
set of linear algebra kernels known as the Basic Linear Algebra
Subroutines (BLAS), and a subset of the linear algebra routines in the
LAPACK library.

dependencies.name: libtool
dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependencies.name: m4
dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description:
Cray's MPICH is a high performance and widely portable implementation of
the Message Passing Interface (MPI) standard.

dependencies.name: scalapack
dependencies.description:
ScaLAPACK is a library of high-performance linear algebra routines for
parallel distributed memory machines. It depends on external libraries
including BLAS and LAPACK for Linear Algebra computations. AMD's
optimized version of ScaLAPACK enables using BLIS and LibFLAME library
that have optimized dense matrix functions and solvers for AMD EPYC
processor family CPUs. LICENSING INFORMATION: By downloading, installing
and using this software, you agree to the terms and conditions of the
AMD AOCL-ScaLAPACK license agreement. You may obtain a copy of this
license agreement from
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/scalapack/eula/scalapack-
libraries-4-1-eula.html
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/scalapack/eula/scalapack-
libraries-eula.html

dependent_to.name: salmon-tddft
dependent_to.description:
SALMON is an open-source computer program for ab-initio quantum-
mechanical calculations of electron dynamics at the nanoscale that takes
place in various situations of light-matter interactions. It is based on
time-dependent density functional theory, solving time-dependent Kohn-
Sham equation in real time and real space with norm-conserving
pseudopotentials.
